Reviews.Title: “Good value in the best location”
Reviews.Author: LauraDrach
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is undoubtly the best in Paris. The room is clean and has a good size, and the staff is very friendly. On the downside, the bathroom could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place!”
Reviews.Author: gottachampthroughit
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The location is excellent. We could see the spires of Notre Dame from our room, and hear the bells. Unbelievable! The room was large enough to fit a cot in addition to the large bed, and the bathroom was fine. The skylight opens, so you get some nice fresh air. It's a bit worn but very comfortable, and the staff is pleasant and helpful, with good English. Finding your way to the proper wing is kind of an adventure--the building is very interesting, but a bit of a maze. The elevator wasn't working well when we were there, so we had to make a long climb a couple of times. As long as you're not elderly or handicapped, that should not discourage you--Paris involves a lot of walking. It's such a cool place, with the beautiful courtyard garden and the open walkways. We stayed four days, and I would certainly go back. I will try to upload pictures later.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great value”
Reviews.Author: sueaussie
Reviews.Content: We had read a number of mixed reviews on Trip Advisor about the Hotel Hospitel but decided to take a chance on staying here for our stay in Paris. Turned out to be an excellent choice. The location is unbelievable - you walk out the front door, turn left and you look straight at Notre Dame cathedral. A short walk to the Seine where you can catch a Batobus to take you to the main attractions of Paris. There are also a couple of free walking tours that leave from outside the Notre Dame. Loads of restaurants, cafes and souvenir shops within a close walking distance. The entrance to the hotel is totally separate to the main entrance to the hospital and the courtyard on the ground level is like an oasis in the centre of the city. There are about 20 steep steps which take you to where the lift is that takes you to the 6th floor, where the hotel accommdation is. We saw nurses and doctors on their 'smoko' breaks and some hospital equipment but at no time on our 5 day stay did we see any patients. The hotel staff speak English and are just lovely. They always have a welcome smile when you walk passed and go out of their way to assist should you need it eg we wanted to organise a shuttle bus to take us to the train station and that was organised for us quickly and efficiently. The rooms are large (for Paris) and very clean. Not flash by any means but very comfortable - large comfortable bed, wardrobe and a big bathroom with shower and bath. The highlight though is the skylight (which is adjusted by remote control). It was a magic moment for us to lie in bed at the end of a long day and listen to the bells of Notre Dame (don't worry, they don't chime all night - the last one is 1am and begins again at 8am). And in the morning you can gaze out of the skylight at the skies of Paris - a great way to wake up. I would definitely stay here again should I return to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'd stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nole78
Reviews.Content: I have been twice to Paris . Both times I have stayed here. If you want safe, clean, convenient, inexpensive lodging this should be your first choice. If you want something else-keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and special place next to Notre Dame!”
Reviews.Author: StefiD
Reviews.Content: Very nice place for short family visit strongly recomended-safe area and close to everything with roof windows to the towers of Notre Dame-rooms are simple but perfectly clean and warm (although beging of March it was quite cold outside);breakfast can be ordered and it is served in room.Staff is helpfull and kind.Only you have to pay attention when coming back after 10PM to use other entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meadowgal
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. The service is good, the rooms are clean and we are a 1-5 minute walk from any metro station. The bells of Notre Dame seem to only ring during the day time. The room service breakfast is good and seems to be cheaper than any other place around.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ddelux
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of Paris, this is it. Really. Because it is actually in the true middle of the city. Walk out the front door and you are standing in front of the Notre Dame. Everything in the city spans out from this location. The hotel is actually a small wing of an operating hospital. So that means there will be people wandering the premises who are there for medical treatment. The rooms are small, but fully functional. This is a clean hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. They make an excellent coffee and croissant for breakfast. The big issue I have with this hotel was the AC. We arrived in Paris during an odd warm front in early October. And unfortunately, the AC in our room did not operate. The only window was a sky light. Consequently, we were not too comfortable. If the AC had worked, I would definitely give it a 4 star rating. I did find the location made it easy for my early morning swim at one of the many nearby indoor pool that Paris is famous for. And I was able to go to the Notre Dame before any of the tour buses arrived. And they arrive early, so you must get out at the crack of dawn. But again, the location allows you to hit places in the city and be back at the hotel quickly. The price is truly what makes this a great find. It is substantially less expensive than any hotel we were able to locate nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitel-Hotel Dieu Paris - A Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: atexaninireland
Reviews.Content: I just do not have enough good things to say about the Hospitel-Hotel Dieu. I just got back from a week's stay in Paris and stayed there. I can recommend it to anyone who wants a clean, safe place to stay with a friendly staff. It's right next to Notre Dame, has easy access to the RER, Metro, just a hop and skip to the Latin Quarter, on the River Seine. One of the wonderful things that I liked about it was the fact that you could hear the bells of Notre Dame every morning. There is a beautiful courtyard out side too that you can enjoy. The price cannot be beat if you are on a budget. The only drawback is that because there are only 14 rooms, you must make reservations ahead of time and it's hard to get in. If you are looking for a 5-star hotel, this is not for you, but I will stay there again and again when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here Easter '09 and what an experience to hear the bells of Notre Dame right from our skylight!”
Reviews.Author: jumpnjive00
Reviews.Content: Though not particularly large, the room was nice and neat, and the bathroom was great (French tub and all). The location for the price was like a dream. You literally can hear the bells and step outside to see the great cathedral. Staff friendly (though in our experience spoke little English) and helpful. Beautiful hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and staff”
Reviews.Author: sandtray
Reviews.Content: We had some doubts about staying in a hospital, but once we passed the glass doors to the hotel, we were in a different place. Our room was clean and inviting and we were well taken care of by the staff. We were in a great location with easy access to everything, and the rates were so much better than other hotels. There are not many rooms, so you have to book early. You do have a view of Notre Dame...if you stand on the bed, but the bells ringing in the morning make up for the limited view. We asked for help in arranging transportation from the airport and they did it willingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, BUT Terrible Access at Times”
Reviews.Author: ktwrigley
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in July, and loved the location...close to the Metro, RER, Right and Left Banks, and to Notre Dame, where we went to Mass several times. The room was small, and they added an extra cot for a third person, which made it very difficult to move around.The folks at the reception desk were lovely, and the cafe au lait in the morning was great.The place was safe and clean...HOWEVER, the elevators to the hotel on the 6th floor of the hospital were often not working (even the patient elevators), which meant that we would have to walk up and down 6 flights of stairs, with luggage at times. Sometimes, we would have to traverse a medical ward to get to another stairwell or working elevator. At times, the staff on the ward would not let us cross over to the hotel area, and we were stuck in a stairwell, not sure where to go. The hotel is not to blame, as it is the hospital's elevators, but it made it so difficult and inconvenient getting in and out of the hotel, especially at night, that we will probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “It's a hospital - don't be fooled into thinking it's a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MR2009
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's located across the street from Notre Dame, but that doesn't make it desirable. It's truly in an active hospital. We're wandering with our bags trying to find the right door to take to the "hotel" when bursting through a door comes a gurney with a patient, escorted by 2 or 3 medical staff. Just not the way to start your Paris vacation. To top it off, our room for the three of us was so, so small. Barely fit our two twin beds and cot. Find somewhere else to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Location.location.location.”
Reviews.Author: LaraineandRichard
Reviews.Content: This is a hospital with 14 rooms on one wing on 6th floor converted to a hotel.you go up in the lift with patients so it is a unique hotel.the hotel accommodates both travelers and some day patients. The price is good.breakfast is extra.there is a small staff cafeteria in the basement for tea and coffee etc. Ile st Louis is 400 meters away for super market,cheese shop and boulangerie. Walk out the door and notre dame is right there,amazing!! Bathroom needs shower curtain but we are told French people shower sitting down in the bath!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi110610
Reviews.Content: This was the second part of a three country trip for us and our first time to France and this hotel rocked!!! We arrived at the smaller Orly airport from Venice and the hotel had offered to arrange for transportation for us but we decided to take care of it ourselves and it was pretty straightforward. We got onto a shuttle bus at the airport that transported us to a RER station and we caught the RER to the Notre Dame stop and you are pretty much there. The htel is literally across the street from Notre Dame and we had a view of the church through our skylight. We went in through the main entrance mostly and after hours there is a little blue door to the side that you can use your room lkey to access. We literally arrived and passed a woman bleeding from her nose on a gurney....yes it really is a FULLY operational --no pun intented---hospital. We went through the information desk and you have the option to either go up a flight of stairs down a really amazing hallway...you can almost feel yourself transported back to the war era....and then take an elevator up to the sixth floor or you can elect to go down the stairs and pass by a beautiful outdoor walkthroughh lowhedge garden. If you do the latter it takes you into a very pretty courtyard where you can truly admire the architecture of the place. Once out of the elevator there is a surgery area but you would turn left and there is the reception area for the hotel and from there on out it looks like a typical hotel corridor. Receptiona and the people who work it are very warm friendly and helpful. The room was your basic hotel room but had a BATHTUB!!!! We loved the skylight and being able to hear the church bells and sleep under fresh air..the window is motorized so you could adjust the angle to whatever you needed it to be. The location cannot be beat!!! We walked evrywhere and if you are not in the mood for walking the subway is right outside the door. This was a great hotel and whenevr we are in Paris it will definitely be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Stourton1582
Reviews.Content: The location next to the Notre Dame Cathedral was second-to-none. Most of the great sites of Paris are within walking distance. There are hundreds of cafes and restaurants in this area. The room was small, but had everything we needed. It was clean and everything worked. The reception staff were extremely helpful, even assisting us to buy long-distance train tickets online, when we couldn't get the English version of the railway website to work properly. Staying in a hospital is quirky, but once inside the room you wouldn't know it was a hospital. The garden is lovely and peaceful and we could see the lit-up cathedral at night through the dormer window. Waking up to the sound of cathderal bells each morning was a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the money - well situated for all Paris sites”
Reviews.Author: SonomaCountyJill
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Hospitel Hotel to find a small room with a skylight view of Notre Dame. This is a spotlessly clean hotel and although small, everything that was needed was there. The adjacent bathroom was a little outdated and you have to try very hard not to splash water everywhere when you are using the combo bathtub/shower but I have found this to be the case in nearly every bathroom in France. The key thing to note about Hospitel Hotel is the location - perfect for access to everything in Paris. The location gives you easy access to both banks and most everything is within walking distance. The hospital garden is beautiful. Unfortunately, one of the nights of our visit was during Nuit Blanche (an all night arts festival) and the noise coming from below all night long was horrific. This was not the fault of the Hotel Hospitel, of course, but if you are visiting during any kind of a noisy event, you may wish to be on the non-Notre Dame side. But, regarding other noises, it was a treat to wake up to the bells of Notre Dame and San Chappelle.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location & price!!”
Reviews.Author: SUV4LAB
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location...you couldn't get a more centrally located hotel in Paris. Everything is close by and it is close to the RER & Metro lines. We took the RER-B line directly from CDG Airport. There is no need to change trains, get off at St. Michel Notre Dame and the hotel is right there at the exit of the RER. The rooms are on the small side and very basic but you get everything you need. Let's face it, as long as you have a private bath, that's really all you need. We barely spent any time in the room so it was fine. The lack of shower curtain in French hotels always drives me crazy but that's just the way it is there - you make do. Our room had electronic shutters over the window so the room was super dark - perfect for sleeping. You get some road noise because of the great location but nothing late into the night. The staff is nice and helpful. I recommend getting breakfast at one of the nearby cafes as the selection and prices aren't very good at the hotel. The Open Top Tour Bus stops right across the street and is a great way to see Paris as a tourist - very convenient and fun to ride. The rooms are sparse and not the cleanest but for the 126 euros we paid for a twin room, it was perfect. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet090
Reviews.Content: Hospitel-Hotel Dieu worked really well for us. The location on Ile de la Cite was excellent for first-time visitors to Paris and allowed us convenient walking access to both the right and left bank areas (as well as Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis, of course). We had an ensuite twin room facing north (i.e. away from Notre Dame) that was very quiet. During the day, the room was lit by a skylight that could be opened by a switch. At night, another switch could be used to lower a shutter for sleeping. The room was small, but we understand that this is normal for small hotels in Paris. More importantly, it was spotlessly kept. The bathroom had a bathtub and hand shower. It did not have a shower curtain, but we understand that this is also normal for small Paris hotels and we managed without it. The hotel staff spoke very good English and were most friendly and helpful. As others have stated, this hotel is located on the 6th floor of a working hospital. You do see patients and hospital staff, as well as empty hospital beds by the elevator by the elevator leading to the hotel. If that sort of thing bothers you, this hotel is not for you. However, at the times we came and went, we did not have to use the emergency room entrance. We used an entrance opposite Notre Dame which bypassed the emergency room. Also, on the way to the elevator, we passed the beautiful, and peaceful, garden at the centre of the hospital. There are two elevators going up to the 6th floor. There is a very small passenger elevator (enough for two people and baggage) and a much larger hospital elevator for hospital staff. We only had to use the hospital elevator once, when the passenger elevator was being serviced. If we are fortunate enough to travel to Paris again, we would certainly rebook with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, and not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Compassrose50
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are in a wing of the hospital. They are small. There is a bath. You enter through the door for the Emergency room! There are patients on the grounds receiving infusions. The walk to the elevator has ancient arches and sketches of the wards during the plaque! If you want luxury, this is not your place. If you want to experience a slice of French history, to see a small view of Notre Dame from a window, to hear the bells of Notre Dame during the day and evening, be close to everything, and the only hotel beds on the I'sle, plus a great deal, this is your spot. One tip: Don't order in, but find the hospital employee cafe on the ground floor, fast, good, and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay here again? Yes!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaydreamerAustralia
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here on recommendations from friends. Yes, it is in a working hospital, but you know that before you book so shouldn't be surprised by the doctors, mobile hospital beds, etc etc. And yes, it's "no frills" accommodation, but it was spotlessly clean and we were only in the room to sleep or freshen up for dinner. The beds are really comfortable (I'm not sure if that's due to the fact that it is in a hospital and must have decent beds for patients). It is a fantastic location, the RER station is literally at the corner of the hospital building and I loved hearing the bells of Notre Dame through our window. Restaurants are only a short walk away in every direction. It's also very close to St Chappell. The staff were fantastic - very helpful, very friendly, and nothing was a bother.

Reviews.Title: “Sssssh! Don't let the secret get out!”
Reviews.Author: NC_tar_heel_64
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here in 2006, and I arrived a day late, due to weather delays. The staff thoughtfully gave my sister a reduced rate for the first night (at the time, it was 105/110 Euro). There is something to be said for going to sleep, gazing through your skylight at the towers of Notre Dame, after having enjoyed the evening entertainment in the plaza just steps from your front door! The room was adequate in size, neat, all we needed as a convenient base for exploring. It was a bonus to walk through the beautifully landscaped courtyard each day, and entering a hospital only adds to the story!

Reviews.Title: “not your typical hotel stay....”
Reviews.Author: ashfield_gp
Reviews.Content: My wife had booked our family with kids to stay here for 3 nights. Can you imagine our surprise to see that it was just across the road from the Notre Dame forecourt with central Paris districts on every side and those trademark Seine bridge vistas every where we looked. The fact that it was located within a very old working hospital added to the charm of the stay. The staff were so thoughtful and friendly and the tariff was such good value. A warning though - for those used to a 4 or 5 star hotel experience this may come as a shock . Patients walk the corridors in wheelchairs and with fresh surgical bandages, staff smoking at some of the entranceways, competition for the lift with chairs and gurneys , and vomit on the floor on one occassion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: RAZYeppoon
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Right across from the Notre Dame. Terrific value, great staff and fantastic location. CLose to Metro station so could reach Airport with no problems. Did not want to leave here, hotel and Paris just georgous.

Reviews.Title: “These guys don't need a review”
Reviews.Author: Tenterfield_Saddler
Reviews.Content: This is the _only_ hotel in Paris so far where the staff have been patient, very friendly and we actually thought they were nice people. To put it in perspective, we've been to Paris before a quite few times. Hotels and rooms are usually small, substandard, and the staff quirky (Think Fawlty Towers). Even if you spend top dollar, you'll almost always be disappointed. I agree with the comment about it being like staying with friends. The other reviews adequately describe the centrality and the cleanliness. At last! - a reasonably priced hotel in Paris that I would go back to. There are issues with access, but we quickly forgot about that. Don't go up the stairs when you come in - go down the small set of stairs instead to the lift in the basement (SS), if you have a lot of bags. We're definitely going back in a couple of years, and will be booking well ahead to get a room at the HHD.

Reviews.Title: “Good value (for Paris) hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Skizz
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. An unmatched location, clean rooms and friendly staff make it very good value for money. We stayed for 2 nights in room 12 in May 2009 for 129 euros/night (remember this is Paris). There are 14 rooms in the attic on the 6th floor of block B1 of the hospital. The even numbered rooms are on the right as you walk down the single corridor from reception - the even numbered rooms "look" out onto Notre Dame (so odd numbered rooms are probably a little quieter). The room compares favourably with 3 star hotels in Paris we've stayed in before. The room is a reasonable size (small compared to rooms elsewhere in the world, but good for Paris in this price bracket). There are single and double rooms, and camp beds are available to allow you to sleep 3 to a room. The staff are friendly and speak English - most guests are from English speaking countries rather than from France itself. The "hospitel" (HOSPIT-al/hot-EL) is a private enterprise - it is not directly related to the hospital. It was one of five such hotel businesses in hospitals but the other 4 have closed. The owner lives out of Paris, but the employees have been there for some time. Relatives of in patients also stay there. We enjoyed staying in a hospital. If you don't like hospitals, stay elsewhere. It's a busy working hospital with 349 beds (224 acute/emergency beds). Block B1 (where the hotel is located) contains a day cardiology unit and a gynaecology ward (including cancer patients) and an emergency department. Unlike many French hospitals, this is still based in lovely old buildings - as one reviewer put it, the ground floor feels a little like a monastery. For medically minded visitors, the hospital has an illustrious history - it was home to Dupuytren, Duchenne and Claude Bernard amongst others. Some reviewers had problems with too much light coming on through the skylight. In our room, the skylight had shutters operated from the same panel as the one which opens/closes the skylight itself. As such, day light wasn't an issue for us as it has been for some other reviewers. As previously described, the bathrooms have a shower but no shower curtain. Fresh towels and basic toileteries are available - 2 plastic cups (wrapped) are left out each day. So, this is not unbridled luxury but a functional hotel. Wireless access is available (at 4 euros/day or 8 euros/3 days or 10 euros/week or 20 euros/for over 7 days) for those of you bringing your own laptop. Note that the safe is too small for a 15.4" screen laptop. The air conditioning worked fine. Coffee and tea and cold drinks are available at reception until 10pm (you pay extra for these). The reception to the hotel is open until 10pm, after which you pick your key up from the reception to the hospital. There are a few guidebooks and a daily paper are available in reception. There is a Relais cafe in the basement (sous sol). We didn't eat there as there are so many places to eat within a few minutes' walk from the front door of the hospital. There's a lovely balcony like area on the 4th floor. I know other have described the location before - but it really is outstanding. Notre Dame Cathedral is the topographical centre of Paris, The square outside the front of Notre Dame is lined by the Cathedral on one side and lined on one of the other sides by the Hotel Dieu. Exit 5 from the RER metro (line B) from Charles de Gaulle airport is about 20 metres from the entrance to the hospital - go out of the front of the hospital and turn right. A great location. Good staff. Reasonably priced for Paris (3star price range). Clean and functional. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This was fun”
Reviews.Author: wanderingMB
Reviews.Content: There's something fun about telling your friends that you are going to stay in a hospital in Paris. We actually shared our elevator with a gurney. But as a traveler, this hotel is perfect for what you really need. The RER leaves the airport and deposits you at the foot of your hotel. The metro is around the corner. You are on the same square as Notre Dame. The staff is friendly and speaks English. You can order and pay for only what you want for breakfast. You're not going to have a view from your room, but the room and bathroom is big enough, the shower hot with a significant shower curtain. The setting is actually quite pretty if not a little spooky late at night-adding to the fun. The price makes this an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific!”
Reviews.Author: tmalia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dieu is one of the best "finds" in the world. The staff was helpful and very kind. Even the housekeeper was thoughtful. It was like staying with friends. The location and access to the Airport were amazing. Even a large American man like I am had enough room to spread out. The bathroom was also a generous size. The challenge is always the lack of an American style mounted shower head. But hey, in that location and at that price who cares! Stay there but don't tell too many people about it. Lets keep this secret between us!

Reviews.Title: “location makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: speak2me2k2
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay in this quirky hotel. the location of the hotel makes it the perfect place to walk to virtually all sights in paris. it is in the center of the city and whatever directions you walk in there are sights and sounds to enjoy. it is a little strange to be staying in a hospital, but after walking in the entrance (go towards notre dame, to the left outside the metro stop) you walk past a lovely courtyard, up a flight of stairs to an elevator that takes you to the hotel. it is small, clean and no frills. the room is a comfortable size and the bathroom does not have a shower curtain or pole for you to put up your own. the staff was nice. if this is all you need then this hotel is a wow for the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you should stay”
Reviews.Author: Seeker_Finder
Reviews.Content: We found this interesting, cheap, no frills hotel to be a very good fit for a week of enjoying the core of old Paris. It is indeed across the street from Notre Dame, in the surgical wing (top floor) of Paris' oldest hospital, Hotel Dieu. You will find very minimal amenities, but a gracious and helpful staff. We were provided with a hair dryer upon request and they replaced the spa-toiletries daily. Most of the week we partook in the optional room-service breakfast.The receptionist even booked a restaurant for us despite our embarrassing English language barrier. If you want you can do like us and stand on your bed and peek out the skylight-rooftop windows to grab a view of Paris from your room. Be aware that these skylight windows are the only windows provided. The best part of this place was the location and price. The worst aspect would be that it's in a working hospital - but that really isn't a deterrent for most thrifty travelers and we got over the creepiness of walking past patients and eye surgeons. Actually, the hospital is quite a neat and original medieval complex. A heavy curious feeling came over us while walking the halls at night with the ancient ambiance of the place; it carries such a dramatic history! Don't miss the Heath Ledger 'Joker' statue near the back of the hospital courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a hotel in a hospital:):):)”
Reviews.Author: D1223chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel and would very happily stay here again. Our room was a decent size (by European standards), pleasant, exceptionally comfortable. Walls a little thin, but we didn't spend much time in the room. It is a fantastic location and great price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience; well worth it”
Reviews.Author: AMMGD
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I spent over Â£130 (including breakfast) for my wife and I to spend one night in a hotel. However, I am pleased I did. It gives to good an opportunity to stay on one of the islands in the middle of the Seine to be true (and is cheap compared to anything else on them). This hotel was wonderful. The location is unbelievable (for info the entrance to the hospital is on the south side of it - we walked most of the way round it before finding it - on the plaza in front of the Notre Dame). The rooms are very nice, with a bathroom complete with bath, always nice after a hard day walking the streets and museums etc. of the city. The skylight (the hotel is in the hospital attic) gave us views of the Seine and over the river towards the Hotel de Ville. Rooms on the other side of the corridor would give views of the Notre Dame I believe. It is a bit strange being in a hospital, but once you get out of the lift and walk into the hotel lobby it is like being in any other nice small and homely hotel or guest house. The breakfast is brought to the room (there is no other option), and is perfectly acceptable without being amazing. I wasn't sure if the noises in the middle of the night were from the guests in the hotel or from downstairs in what I guess would be a hospital ward. That is my one note of caution. The venue will not be everyone's cup of tea, and if you have a phobia of hospitals then your imagination could start to run away with itself. For most people, though, (unless you're looking for unbridled luxury or are on a tight budget) this is the best place you could stay in Paris as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “The Center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: europhile149
Reviews.Content: We entered the hospital and soon walked out an exit on the right, to behold a beautiful gothic courtyard that you would expect to see on an estate. We climbed one flight of stairs which lead us into another section of the hospital and after 20 steps we found a room with a very large elevator, almost as large as our room! We arrived on the 6th floor and the elevator opened up right in front of our hotel â€œwardâ€�. . The reception area was very tiny and upon entering our room, I felt that was tiny, as well. The only window was a sky light so the view consisted of clouds, blue sky, and a few birds, here and there. The tiny closet barely had room for clothes and there was absolutely no furniture for clothes storage. Okay, I can live with this for 8 days. Then, my worst nightmare, a bathtub without a shower curtain. Why canâ€™t a room with a flat screen TV have a bathtub shower curtain? Mind you, this modern TV had only 4 stations and they were all French-speaking. As time progressed, what seemed like a room void of most traveler â€œnecessitiesâ€� transformed into a quaint, enchanted domain. Upon further encounter of the close kind, I realized that this entire room, reception, and hallway were immaculately clean . I mastered the tub situation . Reclining on the bed, one could look out the window & watched the clouds, swallows, rain, snow flakes, and jet paths. It was a pleasure to open and close the sky light window with the push of a button. Rather than a city view, â€œthe sky was the limit!â€� If we were hungry or thirsty, we could step outside the room make a right turn, take 12 steps and there were a choice of beverages including water, soda, beer, wine, various teas & coffee. Moreover, snacks were available. If you were real hungry and you did not want to go out, you took the elevator to the 1st floor, descended a flight of steps and a hospital cafeteria served warm food. The TV that featured 4 French channels served as my instructor parce que je peut ecouter en francais et my French improved. The hotel staff were charming and ready to help in any way possible. Our double room with twin beds was 120 Euro a night and for Paris, this was a great price. The location was absolutely center & you could take a nice stroll to most of the fascinating museums, squares, and great sights. Within walking distance were the Comedie Francaise, The Louvre, Pompidou Center, the Tuileries, Place de la Concorde, Musee Dâ€™Orsay,, St. Sulpice, Luxembourg Gardens, the Eifel Tower, Opera Garnier, Galeries Lafayette, Place des Vosges, and Hotel de Ville. If you like to walk & you are not looking for bathrobes & fancy soaps & gels,select this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: xelar8
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, right opposite the notre dame. We were able to take the hop on/off tour bus from virtually right outside the door! Staff were friendly, room was comfortable and big enough. Only problems were no shower curtain over bath meaning everything on floor gets wet, the skylight was broken making it difficult to open and close, and the hospital grounds are dark and creepy at night. Don't choose this hotel if you have a phobia of old tiny lifts! Room service is offered for breakfast only. We preferred to walk around paris to get our food. We would recommend walking to the latin quarter to get a cheap feed.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Great, but not quite.”
Reviews.Author: TellinStories
Reviews.Content: On the whole a decent hotel. The location is about as central as you can get, however this has the problem that all the cafes and restaurants nearby are ludicrously overpriced even by Paris standards. However that is always the trade off when you have a very central location. The rooms are small, like all Parisian hotels I've stayed in, but decently equipped (no kettle though, like most European hotels). Staff are friendly and speak English, and the rooms are cleaned thoroughly daily. The windows are high - more of a skylight, but you could see the top of Notre Dame nevertheless. The hospital grounds are lovely by day, although a little creepy by night, however it is wonderful to sit outside Notre Dame on a warm Summer evening listening to people sing or play guitars and then be able to pop into your room within a minute. A few minor issues prevented our stay from being as pleasant as it could have been. Firstly the bath plug didn't fit properly and there was no shower curtain, which ends up annoying you after a few days. The weather was very hot and the air con had an annoying drip when in use - with the noise of people outside if the window was open, and the drip drip if it was shut, I couldn't sleep without ear plugs. The drips only *just* missed the TV too. Staff were told of this but weren't really able to help other than give extra towels to mop up the puddle that formed under the air con. If these few little issues were resolved the hotel would have been given a 4 or 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Convenient, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: TonyFNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 ( with an 80 year old mother) really enjoyed our stay here. Thanks to the previous reviews, the entrance can be hard to find if you are looking for a hotel. Instead, look for the emergency entrance to the hospital right in the Notre Dame square. It definitely has an atmosphere of antiquity being in a hospital that's a few hundred years old. But once you are in the hotel, the atmosphere changes to that of a well taken cared of hotel unit. The staff speak very good english. More importantly, they were very caring and helpful. They even will hand deliver a pot of hot water to my mother's room! Rooms were very clean, shower and tub were just right. Location is the best you can get. Will definitely book again, but you need MANY months to do so to ensure a room availability.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: faustina1
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this place. It is true that the windows are up high, but the price is great for the location, right next to Notre Dame, and the concierges are kind and helpful--and they speak English. The hotel is actually in the hospital--seems to be in the eye surgery part of the hospital, and you see patients with eye patches loaded onto elevators. The hospital gardens are lovely. There is a nice cheap snack restaurant on the grounds--wonderful for morning coffee and pastry, or lunch sandwiches. We were in the center of everything. I would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tiggerinFL
Reviews.Content: This was a girlfriend getaway, it was the most awesome trip I have ever taken. I love Paris and can't wait to return. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Dieu. It was an awesome place to stay, everyone was very friendly and helpful. 2 of the girls in our group are nurses and one is a pharmacy tech. They loved seeing the hospital. Walking out of the hotel on the first morning and seeing the Notre Dame cathedral was amazing. We used the subway and bus systems to get everywhere. The transportation system around Paris is so easy to use. There are a lot of restaurtants within walking distance. We tried several while we were there and everyone of them was excellent. We stayed in the Hotel Dieu for 7 nights and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: Chalky66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and found this hotel to be ideal for us as first time visitors to Paris. Good rates,110 euro per night for a double room (breakfast is extra and delivered to your room), great location being right on the Parvis du Notre Dame and just over the bridge from the Latin quarter with it's vibrant nightlife. Hotel is only yards away from the Metro and RER making it easy to visit all the main attractions. Rooms basic but clean and comfortable, and staff were very helpful and friendly. A bit weird staying in a working hospital but the building and grounds were lovely. If you want all mod cons then this is not the hotel for you, but if you want a good budget hotel in an excellent location to explore the city then I would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Short on cash but want a great location? Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDealer
Reviews.Content: What a great idea for a hotel; on top of a hospital! Initially, it was a bit odd to have folks wheeled by on gurnies and to see others outside smoking with their IV bag, but, it was easy enough to get used to. Thanks to the other reviewers who left directions into the hotel, or, it might have been difficult to find the entrance. First, the location cannot be beat. Right on Notre Dame square, you have access to metro stations and are right by the Latin Quarter. There were so many restaurants in the area that we never went hungry (including Nos Ancetres Les Gaulois). The price is also incredible. We stayed during the Paris air show and our room was only 100Euro a night! The room and bathroom were both clean. The area was small, of course, but quite comfortable. You wouldn't want to chose this hotel if you were planning on spending lots of time in the room, i think you could become quite clausterphobic. The only downside is that our windows were all in the ceiling. We were able to stand on our bed, however, and have a good view of Notre Dame. :) There was also not a breakfast so to speak. I think there were some items available to order, but really, it wasn't worth it. There are so many cafes in the area that it's better to go to one of them. This hotel is great for backpackers or for those who just want to save money on a hotel and redirect it to eat good food and drink good wine. We'll definitely stay there again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: mavis123
Reviews.Content: The location directly across from Notre Dame is the main attraction to this hotel. the budget price, cleanliness, comfortable rooms and bathrooms are the bonus. Previous reviews are spot on about life in a hospital - but being a nurse I felt right at home!! The hospital is mainly a day surgery hospital, so it is very quiet on weekends, but by Monday morning it is buisness as usual and getting a spot on the lift gets tricky. There is an RER and locat metro stop right out front, and you only have to walk across the bridge over the Seine to get to the bustling Latin Quarter and St Germaine for fantastic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, big bath for Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Sarge56
Reviews.Content: We are adult mom and daughter. Stayed here only one night on way to Italy. But it was awesome. When we go back to Paris, we will definitely try to book here. You cannot beat price (110E) or location (Ile de la Cite), across from Notre Dame. We stayed in Room #7. Room is small, but clean. Bathroom is very large by European standards and had a full bath along with removeable hand-held shower head. Nothing fancy, but the staff were very friendly and spoke English very well. If seeing doctors and patients (and really, quite infrequently) would unnerve you, then you might look elsewhere. (My mom was nurse and sister is nurse and two brothers-in-law are doctors. So we had no issue with it.) Grounds are pretty, too. Lovely courtyard. RER/Metro is literally right outside the front door. Taxi stand, too. Love this place! And our stay helped the hospital care for charity cases!:) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ssgk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hospital hotel in Paris for 5 nights. All desk personnel speak english and staff is very friendly and accomodating. Good bang for the buck in such a centrally located hotel. Inside a working hospital on Ile de a Cite, next door to Notre Dame. Metro/RER stop just steps out the front door. Advice for people who must have coffee in the morning. Hard to find a reasonably priced cup of coffee in this area. Order morning coffee from the front desk, just a few Euros, and they bring it to your room. You can buy an 8 Euro full breakfast but we just stuck to coffee. Highly recommend this place if hospitals don't bother you. FYI, we paid 110 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FABCON
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Dieu for a week last month and had a blast! The location was perfect, the room was small but extremely clean and very comfortable and the staff just couldn't have been more accomodating and friendly! And the Hospitel with it's garden was very beautiful! I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to all my friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenyFromTheBlock
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights. You might think it is weird that the hotel is in a hospital, but its really a great place. My only complaint was that the bed was a little hard. Notre Dame is literally across the street from the hospital, and the bells didn't bother me at all when I was sleeping. I thought it was actually nice to hear them, but with the window closed you can hardly hear them. The metro was conveniently locate just around the corner. The room was clean and had extra pillows and blanket. The bathroom was adequate, except that the shower didn't have a curtain on it, so you had to be careful not to get water all over the floor. There was an air conditioner, which was nice in august. The staff was friendly and helped us find a few things we needed around town and maps of Paris are provided in the lobby, which really helped us out. The front desk is only staffed until 10 pm, but you don't have any trouble getting into your room. They offer breakfast at 8 euros per person, which is delivered to your room at your specified time. For the most part we took advantage of the cafes in Paris for breakfast, but one morning we got up early to beat the crowds and got the hotel breakfast to speed up the morning. It was very good, and fairly reasonably priced since you will spend as much wherever else you go. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to my friends and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dickey lift.”
Reviews.Author: schaf1
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to this forum for tips on this well situated hostel and particularly to the person who gave such good directions on access as we arrived at night with heavy luggage. Attic type room small but clean. Did not need to use the aircon. Window positioned on roof line and we left it partially open all the time. Was a luxury to have a bath every day after sightseeing. Safe in the room but no fridge. No English TV channel did not bother us but insufficient light for reading was a nark. We needed to use torches to read. Staff helpful and supplied hot water free for my tea bags. I had my own sugar and bought little milk containers from a store. H'ever you could purchase cups of tea/coffee from the office. There is also a small staff cafe downstairs where I had 'cup of soup'; hubby had sandwich. I don't care for continental type breakfasts so gave that a miss. I took the lift to 4th or ground floor to have a smoke. Office closes at 10pm but you have a keycard for entry. Lift packed it in on last day so we used another one to the 4th floor and then used the stairs. Bit awkward lugging our heavy cases down two floors then a walk to the other lift then more stairs to exit. But Paris was only part of our trip so we had clothes for cold and warm weather packed. Police station next door (sirens). Church bells. Busker playing same music every night at a nearby bridge. But I liked hearing all these different sounds. Having worked in a hospital I felt comfortable with the environment and you steer clear of the wards anyway. However the signage, trolleys etc do say 'hospital' in case anyone is not comfortable with that . To me, it was like a big old monastry and I loved the long corridors and arches. Also comforting to know that medical help is handy should the need should arise (as it did once before). We purchased beer, wine, salads from a grocery store over the bridge (right bank) at Chatalet; 2 streets from MacDonalds. We ate most nights over the bridge at places on the Left Bank. If you're a 4 or 5 star person, it would not suit you. If you like something quite unique it would. The position is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: treechaser
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the following reviews on this incredible place. We just returned today from a wonderful trip in Paris. I never would have known about this place if it weren't for Tripadvisor, and, wow, what a find! Yes, it's a little strange to stay in the attic of a working hospital, but the price, location, and convenience make it well worth it. This was by far the cheapest place I could find to stay in, but it was nicer than many 3 or 4 star hotels I've visited in Europe. The staff was wonderfully helpful and friendly. The room was clean and very quiet. It literally sits on the same square as the Notre Dame Cathedral. A Metro Stop is just a few minutes walk. There's plenty to see and do RIGHT next to the hotel. It's not luxurious, but we didn't spend any time in the room other than to sleep anyway. I was concerned that it would be rather loud as it's in such a busy area of Paris, but it was silent at night (I guess since it's so high). We had no trouble finding it, thanks to following reviews. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and outstanding family experience!”
Reviews.Author: Americanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel tucked away in a historic hospital. We are a family with 3 teenage daughters and this was our first trip to France for all of us. After reading reviews from this site I went ahead and booked 2 hotel rooms. The rooms were cozy and very clean. We slept well and were awakened to the chiming of Notre Dame Cathedral bells. It was a beautiful sound. Not only that, the location of this hotel is ideal. We walked everywhere and found it very convenient to return to the hotel. The staff was effecient and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a quiet small hotel in the midst of the city. The fact that it is on the top floor of a historic and active hospital makes it all the more interesting and charming. It was a very good value for our money and we would return if we ever get the chance. I keep telling others about this special place and they plan to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dieu Redeemed themselves”
Reviews.Author: travelingquilter
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you all that after our hotel reservations were cancled I was so up set that I sent that last review never dreaming that the Hotel Dieu would make good on our reservations. well, after a phone call and email to the hotel that included a copy of our original confirmation date of 12/7/06, we got the good news from Hotel Dieu that they were able to honor our reservations after all. we are gona have 2 triple rooms instead of what we reserved (3 doubles) but it's doable, we dont care, we have rooms again!! A big thank you to the Hotel Dieu for making it right! We can now leave for our trip with no worries!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good But With Reservations”
Reviews.Author: pixfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from February 18, 2007 until February 24, 2007. I stayed in room 14, a room with a single bed. The positive points: Excellent location - literally in the shadow of Notre Dame Next to an RER station - easy access to CDG Very helpful and friendly staff - they were outstanding Quiet, very quiet rooms Very clean The negative points: Is it really a 3-star hotel? I would think it is a good 2-star. It is weird staying in a hospital Although the location is excellent, the area lacks a "neighborhood" feeling The only windows were skylights Conclusion: I really enjoyed staying here - I really did. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable and quiet place, this is it. However, next time I think I will look for something in a neighborhood area like the 5th or 6th

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: CanOz11
Reviews.Content: After seeing this interesting hotel on a travel show, we had to give it a try. We took the train from Charles de Gaulle airport and had a bit of trouble with our huge luggage. Why would they put an escalator to exit the metro and then 2 flights of stairs afterwards? Cruel. Nothing to do with the hotel though. Word of advice. The entrance is right on the square with Notre Dame. Some tired travellers missed it and walked completely around the block (and a large block it is) before finding the entrance. The emergency department reception is there and you have no choice but to go to the right. After that take a left and you'll enter a lovely courtyard. There are several stairs up and a few stairs down. If you're tired and have heavy bags take the stairs down, go right and then left, past the cafe and the B lift is on the right. Take the elevator to the 6th floor and the hotel is right there next to Cardiology! Sounds confusing but really not bad once you've done it once. The rooms themselves are fine by Paris standards and definitely for the location. The only disappointment was no shower curtain which makes showering without washing down the bathroom a bit tricky. I have come across this elsewhere in Europe though. Lovely bilingual staff were very friendly and helpful. Windows in the roof allow you to see the stars from your bed on a clear night. It's a bit strange to walk past doctors in the corridor on your way in and out. I didn't see any patients on trolleys though. They must be in a different wing. Definitely a great experience. Cross the river to the Latin Quarter for a plethora of restaurants ideal for tourist but still providing excellent food. And don't miss a Nutella crepe. C'est magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this position!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesabroad
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel on the trip advisor website and after staying there, were glad we did. No it is not 5 star, but by Paris standards the rooms are of adequate size, with nice large bathrooms, and very clean. Staff are helpful and speak good English. Walking out the front door of the hospital into the Place de Parvis, Notre Dame is on your left a few seconds walk, RER station and metro, at the corner, the river Seine directly in front of you. It is just the best spot, right in the centre of Paris within walking distance to many interesting sightseeing destinations. We have recommended it to many people since returning home to Sydney (my daughter is a travel agent) and we are sure it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaliSwissMiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hospitel-Hotel Dieu in the middle of Paris. The hotel is literally right next to the Notre Dame cathedral and is steps away from the metro. The hotel is on the top floor of a busy, public teaching hospital, built in 1877 which is pretty unusual, but we found it to be a very charming and a wonderful place to stay. We had a little trouble finding the hotel, but the main lobby of the hospital (who will point you in the direction of the hotel) is just across from the square in front of the Notre Dame. There is an elevator, which is helpful in getting to the 6th floor! At night, when the reception desk of the hospital is closed, we were given a key for the side door, or you can just walk through the ER! The double room was average size, clean and comfortable. We had a view (from our very high window) of the Notre Dame. The hotel is very safe and quiet (hey, you are in a hospital!) with the only real noise coming from the bells of Notre Dame (only during the day). It was such a charming and unusual place to stay. The staff was so helpful and recommended some great restaurants in Paris. We loved this hotel and would stay there again. What a find!

HotelInfo.Name: Hospitel-Hotel Dieu Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 1, place du Parvis | 04 Arr., 75004 Paris, France
